intro: Taraxacum teuvaeense, commonly known as the Teuvae dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the island of Teuvae in the South Pacific, where it thrives in moist, coastal environments. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are typically hairy and have a bluish-green hue. Its flowers are yellow and form a single composite head, typical of the dandelion genus. Taraxacum teuvaeense is adapted to the specific ecological conditions of its native habitat, making it a unique and rare botanical species.
